channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Spotify Keeps the Profit Tune Humming
item.description: Music streamer shows it can flex pricing power while keeping costs down.

item.title: The surprising way the bond market is reacting to Trump vs. Harris
item.description: Slight changes in the direction of Treasury yields are acting as a barometer of traders’ sentiment about the race for the White House.

item.title: Revolut Targets Valuation Jump to $45 Billion in Sign of Fintech Revival
item.description: The world’s second most-valuable fintech startup is nearing a deal to sell about $500 million worth of employee-owned shares.

item.title: SunPower’s stock skyrockets despite company’s challenges: ‘Shorts dug themselves a hole here’
item.description: SunPower shares climbed 25.4% Tuesday despite the challenges facing the maker of solar-energy technology.

item.title: How Kamala Harris Manages Her Money: Index Funds and a 2.625% Mortgage
item.description: The vice president and her husband maintain a largely low-risk portfolio of assets, including passive investments and cash.

item.title: Treasury yields slip from 2-week highs after Harris gets enough support to be likely Democratic nominee
item.description: U.S. government debt rallied for the first time in four sessions on Tuesday after Vice President Kamala Harris won enough support to become the Democr...

item.title: Lenders Tout a New Way to Transfer Risk, but Why Bother?
item.description: Banks such as Ally Financial are turning to structured finance to flatter their capital ratios.

item.title: Lineage anchors busiest dollar-volume week for IPOs so far in 2024
item.description: Seven deals on the calendar aim to raise about $5 billion, led by a $3.6 billion deal from Lineage, a chilled-warehouse REIT.

item.title: The 401(k) Rollover Mistake That Costs Retirement Savers Billions
item.description: Much of the money moved into IRAs misses out on market returns.

item.title: Musk and other billionaires may not like what ‘Trump 2.0’ does to their wealth
item.description: Investors may be wise to hedge against ‘Trump-flation.’
